text: You press, right?
Yeah, right enough.

Are you sure you won't take him down the
road?
It's been a while since we've done it.

The rest of the world is forgetting we're
here.
Time to remind them.

I thought I told you to run that soil over to
Steiner's.
No, no, no, I didn't. Didn't like him.
He didn't buck hard enough for him.

Didn't buck hard enough? He bucked hard
enough for me.

Well, what do you want to do? Do you want to
put him through a sale?
No. He'll end up in the slaughterhouse.

You can't have him killed just because he
doesn't want to be ridden.
Hell, I don't want to be ridden either.
All right, well, I'll figure it out.
That's it?
Anything else you feel like discussing?

If you're joining the family, can you please
be the one person in it who f***ing talks to
me?

I love her, sir. And I'll always take care of
her.
That's why I said yes.

You know why people don't come and talk to
you?

Cause they're scared they're gonna let you
down.
I know I am.

Well, if you're marrying Beth, you've already
proved you're not scared of anything.
Yeah.
That horse needs a home.
Just ain't mine.
Go find him one.
Yes, sir.
He doesn't mind that?
Hell, no. He loves it.
It's like f***ing candy to him.
Helps her guts.

Keeps him from getting ulcers and from
colicing.
Last one.
Jimmy, go hook up the trailer.
Load up that saw away.

When you're done doing what you're doing,
come out to the truck line.
What for?
I want some company.
